description: Difference between the closest square and the closest cube to n.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..10000
example: a(46)=15 because the nearest square is 49 and the nearest cube is 64 and 64-49=15
mathematica: dsc[n_]:=Module[{s=Floor[Sqrt[n]],c=Floor[Power[n, (3)^-1]],ns,nc}, ns= Nearest[{s^2,(s+1)^2},n]; nc=Nearest[{c^3,(c+1)^3},n];Abs[nc-ns]]; Flatten[ Array[dsc,100,0]] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Aug 19 2011 *)
prog: (PARI) { for (n=0, 10000, x=n^(1/2); s=floor(x)^2; t=ceil(x)^2; if (n-s > t-n, s=t); x=n^(1/3); c=floor(x)^3; d=ceil(x)^3; if (n-c > d-n, c=d); write("b061023.txt", n, " ", abs(c-s)) ) } [From _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 16 2009](Haskell)a061023 n = abs (a053187 n - a201053 n)a061023_list = map a061023 [0..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 28 2011
author: Hareendra Yalamanchili (hyalaman(AT)mit.edu), May 24 2001
extensions: More terms from Harvey P. Dale, Aug 19 2011
